pr_title: Add missing helloworld samples + delete excess logging code

timeline.message: Add missing helloworld (GCS generic, error) samples

timeline.bodyText: Ok, but one would imagine such a thing as doing a single string.Format() and log just once.
timeline.author: lesv

replies.bodyText: Even if it's across multiple lines? (Doable, but might not look the cleanest IMO)
replies.author: ace-n

replies.bodyText: This is grouped data, you want it to appear in the log together.  It will on Functions, so it's probably Ok in this use case, but other use cases where things are multi-threaded and concurrent, not so much.  A simple string makes it be just a single log write, how it actually appears in the logs might not have the \n's, but at least they would all be together.  There are other techniques to do this, but a single string is the easiest.
replies.author: lesv

timeline.message: Add functions_helloworld_method + rename tests to match DRIFT spec
